articles.title: Forever Young: Scientists Reveal the Secret to a Strange Animal’s Eternal Youth - SciTechDaily
articles.description: In sea anemones, highly conserved genes guarantee the lifelong differentiation of neurons and glandular cells. Sea anemones are seemingly immortal animals. They seem to be immune to aging and the negative impacts that humans experience over time. However, the…
articles.content:
Cross-section through a tentacle of a transgenic sea anemone showing differentiation products of the SoxC cell population (magenta) and retractor muscles (yellow). Credit: Andreas Denner

articles.author: Richard Luscombe
articles.title: Nasa’s rocket launch to the moon next week aims to close 50-year gap - The Guardian
articles.description: Nasa’s rocket Artemis is going to launch again – but why exactly are we going to the moon again?
articles.content: Fifty years ago this month, mission managers at the US space agency Nasa gave the final go-ahead for what would turn out to be humanitys most recent odyssey to the moon. Few realized at the time it w… [+5047 chars]

articles.author: Michelle Starr
articles.title: Remnants of Ancient Earth-Like World Seen Being Eaten by a Star - ScienceAlert
articles.description: The main sequence life of a star like the Sun may not end in a supernova like the most massive stars out there, but it will not be a quiet affair.
articles.content:
